snippet: An appeals court ruled that a federal law excluding same-sex couples from benefits is unconstitutional. But this is unlikely to be the final word.
abstract: Editorial observes that the federal appeals court ruling that struck down part of the Defense of Marriage Act sets the stage for what will almost certainly be a Supreme Court showdown over the unfair treatment of gay people and their families; urges the Supreme Court to let the ruling stand; calls on Congress to go further and repeal the law.
lead_paragraph: An appeals court ruled that a federal law excluding same-sex couples from benefits is unconstitutional. But this is unlikely to be the final word.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
